SecurityProfile.Name: # Toolbox
SecurityProfile.Description: ## Don't add server/endpoints to this policy level

SecurityProfile.Name: DISABLE ALL
SecurityProfile.Description: This policy is meant to disable DSA for troubleshooting

SecurityProfile.Name: Windows OS Standard
SecurityProfile.Description: Base policy for Windows server and Windows Endpoint

SecurityProfile.Name: Windows Servers
SecurityProfile.Description: Don't add server/endpoints to this policy

SecurityProfile.Name: Base Policy - Trend Micro
SecurityProfile.Description:
## Don't add server/endpoints to this policy level Version: 2023-08-28 This is a best effort base policy, it's not the final policy and this policy needs to be configured according to the customer needs before being used.
All config in these policies is based on Trend Micro Best Practice for Deep Security/Workload Security and from Microsofts recommendations according antimalware exclusions. See sources below.
* https://help.deepsecurity.trendmicro.com/Deep_Security_20_Best_Practice_Guide.pdf * https://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/953.microsoft-anti-virus-exclusion-list.aspx * https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/security/defender-endpoint/configure-server-exclusions-microsoft-defender-antivirus?view=o365-worldwide#list-of-automatic-exclusions
## Change log 2023-08-28 * Migrated exclusion lists to be added in "Exclusions" Antimalware section * Removed exclusions from "Malware Scan Configurations"
2023-06-01 * Changed all Windows Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI) settings to Terminate
2023-03-01 * Remove some exclusions from Exchange 2019 Directory/Process lists based on new Microsoft AV recommendations * Changed "Automatically implement Intrusion Prevention Recommendations:" to NO for Windows Endpoints Polices * Changed "Implement core Endpoint & Workload rules automatically:" to YES on endpoint policies
2023-01-23 * Added new policies for Windows Endpoints and Windows Servers
## Change log 2022-12-20 * Changed to "${windir}\Temp\OICE_*\" in Exchange directory list
## Change log 2022-11-21 * Changed Device Control to disabled in Linux Policy (Not supported) * Added Hyper-V policy * Updated some Windows standard files exclusions to use full path * Updated policy names under "Base Policy - Trend Micro > Windows"
2022-11-15 * Updated Mac and Linux Policies to use Real-time Malware Configuration Scans for Linux and Mac.

PortList.Name: Remote Desktop
PortList.Description: Ports for accessing a machine using remote desktop/terminal services

Trend Mac OS Real-Time Scan Configuration
Trend Windows OS Real-Time Scan Configuration

PayloadFilter2.Name: Netlogon Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability Over SMB (Zerologon) (CVE-2020-1472)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to use MS-NRPC to connect to a domain controller to obtain domain administrator access.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Filter Manager Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2018-8333)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An Elevation of Privilege vulnerability exists in Filter Manager when it improperly handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute elevated code and take control of an affected system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Netlogon Elevation Of Privilege Vulnerability (Zerologon) (CVE-2020-1472)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to use MS-NRPC to connect to a domain controller to obtain domain administrator access.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified NTLM Brute Force Attempt (ZeroLogon) (CVE-2020-1472)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This is a heuristic based DPI rule to detect Brute Force attempt using NTLM authentication for ZeroLogon vulnerability.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified DCERPC AddPrinterDriverEx Call Over SMB Protocol
PayloadFilter2.Description:
This DPI rule detects an AddPrinterDriverEx request.
While not inherently malicious, known vulnerabilities exist in Windows Spooler Service which could be exploited using this call.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified DCERPC AddPrinterDriverEx Call Over TCP Protocol
PayloadFilter2.Description:
This DPI rule detects an AddPrinterDriverEx request.
While not inherently malicious, known vulnerabilities exist in Windows Spooler Service which could be exploited using this call.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB DLL Injection Exploit Detected (ATT&CK T1055.001)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
This rule is based on heuristics and will detect dll injection attack is being performed using SMB share. This rule could generate many alerts on some network environment hence each trigger needs further investigation to ensure attack.
Note: This rule only detects traffic and does not block.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0267)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is vulnerable to an out of bounds read vulnerability in the SMB Server component. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of SMBv1 requests. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a target SMB server. Successful exploitation could possibly result in the disclosure of information which may be used to facilitate further attacks.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-8543)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists, when Windows Search handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of the affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMBv1 Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0271)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
An information disclosure vulnerability has been reported in the SMB Server component of Microsoft Windows. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of SMBv1 requests. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a target SMB server. Successful exploitation could result in the disclosure of information which may be used to facilitate further attacks.
Note: The triggers of this rule have to be investigated further to confirm attacks.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-8620)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists, when Windows Search handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of the affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Out-Of-Bounds Read Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2017-11781)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An out of bounds read vulnerability exists in the SMB Server component of Microsoft Windows due to improper handling of SMBv1 requests. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted SMBv1 request to a target SMB server. Successful exploitation could possibly result in denial of services conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2017-0039)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exist when Windows fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it in run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Office OLE DLL Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2016-7275)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Microsoft Office fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it at run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2016-0100)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Microsoft Office fails to validate the authenticity of a dll file before loading it when opening a PPSX file. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Server SMBv1 Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2017-11815)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
An information disclosure vulnerability has been reported in the SMB Server component of Microsoft Windows. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of SMBv1 requests. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a target SMB server. Successful exploitation could result in the disclosure of information which may be used to facilitate further attacks.
Note: The triggers of this rule have to be investigated further to confirm attacks.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-11771)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists, when Windows Search handles objects in memory. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take control of the affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Malware AGENT.BTZ Domain Blocker
PayloadFilter2.Description: This filter blocks domains used by AGENT.BTZ worm.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Pointer Reference Memory Corruption Vulnerability Domain Blocker
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability has been discovered in Internet Explorer, which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a user's system. This filter blocks domains serving malicious IE7 exploits.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Server Service Vulnerability (wkssvc)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Server service on Windows systems. The vulnerability is due to the service not properly handling specially crafted RPC requests. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Integer Overflow In IPP Service Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists on Windows systems running IIS with the internet printing service enabled. This issue could allow a remote, authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Suspicious TLS Request (ATT&CK T1190)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule identifies the malicious TLS request which can be used to compromise a web server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Multimedia File Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: Integer overflow in Adobe Flash Player 9.0.115.0 and earlier, and 8.0.39.0 and earlier, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted SWF file with a negative Scene Count value, which passes a signed comparison, is used as an offset of a NULL pointer, and triggers a buffer overflow.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Suspicious TLS Request - 1 (ATT&CK T1190)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule identifies the malicious TLS traffic t which can be used to compromise the web server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Multiple Products PDF JavaScript Method Buffer Overflow
PayloadFilter2.Description: Multiple buffer overflows in Adobe Reader and Acrobat 8.1.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a PDF file with long arguments to unspecified JavaScript methods.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Windows Port Mapper Decoder
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Remote Procedure Call (RPC) is an interprocess communication (IPC) mechanism that enables data exchange and invocation of functionality residing in a different process. A client will call the endpoint mapper (EPM) at the server to ask for a "well known" service. The server will answer the client at which port this service is available. This rule decodes the port shared by the Server using DCE/RPC Endpoint Mapper (EPM) Protocol, and helps other rules for monitoring traffic on the dynamically opened port.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows svcctl ChangeServiceConfig2A() Memory Corruption Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: There exists a memory corruption vulnerability in svcctl service of DCE-RPC which can be used by attackers to cause a denial of service attack on the affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Reverse Shell Communication Over HTTPS (ATT&CK T1071.001)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule heuristically detects the initial communication between compromised machine and C&C server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Word Malformed Object Pointer Remote Code Execution
PayloadFilter2.Description: A zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Word has been discovered and is being exploited in the wild. The unspecified vulnerability loads variants of some well-known Trojans on the target host which contacts its mother ship designated at a specific address.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows 'KeAccumulateTicks()' SMB2 Packet Remote Denial Of Service Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is prone to a remote denial-of-service vulnerability. A remote attacker can exploit this issue to crash the Windows kernel, denying service to legitimate users.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Pool Corruption Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Null Pointer Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB (SMB) packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the computer to stop responding until restarted.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Race Condition Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Memory Corruption Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows CHM Notepad Remote Code Execution
PayloadFilter2.Description: The MS HTML Help control ActiveX is prone to a remote CHM help file hijack vulnerability when applications invoke help. Successful exploitation can cause remote code execution.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Memory Allocation Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client implementation allocates memory when parsing specially crafted SMB responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code and take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Response Parsing Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client implementation parses specially crafted SMB transaction responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Message Size Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client implementation handles specially crafted SMB responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Pool Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Print Spooler Service Impersonation Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Windows Print Spooler service that could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected Windows XP system. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows 'CreateSizedDIBSECTION()' Thumbnail View Stack Buffer Overflow Vulnerability Over Network Share
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is prone to a remote stack-based buffer-overflow vulnerability in the Windows Graphics Rendering Engine because the software fails to perform adequate boundary-checks on user-supplied data. An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing an unsuspecting user to open a malicious '.MIC' or office file.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Suspicious Microsoft DLL File Over Network Share
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Windows handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system. This rule is based on heuristics and will only detect DLL file being accessed over SMB share. Hence this rule should be applied when DLL files are not used over the network.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Active Directory 'BROWSER ELECTION' Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in Mrxsmb.sys in Microsoft Windows Server Active Directory allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted BROWSER ELECTION request.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Response Parsing Vulnerability (CVE-2011-0660)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client validates specially crafted SMB responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Transaction Parsing Vulnerability (CVE-2011-0661)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB packet to a computer running the Server service. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Client Transaction Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client implementation handles specially crafted SMB transaction responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Variable Validation Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Stack Exhaustion Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB compounded requests. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Buffer Underflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol handles specially crafted file names. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would require authentication because the vulnerable function is only reachable when the share type is a disk, and by default, all disk shares require authentication.

PayloadFilter2.Name: License Logging Server Heap Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft License Logging Server software handles specially crafted RPC packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Pathname Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An authenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB packets. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a system running the Server service as an authenticated user. While an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of the affected system, attempts to exploit this vulnerability will most probably result in a Denial of Service condition.

PayloadFilter2.Name: DNSMessenger Malware C&C Traffic Over DNS Protocol
PayloadFilter2.Description: This DPI rule is intended to block known malicious C&C Traffic observed over DNS protocol.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMBv2 Infinite Loop Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB version 2 (SMBv2) packets. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the computer to stop responding until restarted.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Print Spooler Load Library Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote, authenticated elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the Windows Print Spooler that could allow an arbitrary dynamic link library (DLL) to be loaded by the Print Spooler. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code with elevated privileges. Administrator should disable this filter if they want to load dynamic link library from arbitrary location.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Reverse Shell Communication Over HTTPS - 3 (ATT&CK T1071.001)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule heuristically detects the initial communication between the compromised machine and C&C server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Reverse Shell Communication Over HTTPS - 4 (ATT&CK T1071.001)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule heuristically detects the initial communication between the compromised machine and C&C server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Windows Mail Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-2016)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Windows Address Book component while loading the DLL file. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Lync Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-1849)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Lync handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Vulnerability In Windows Shell Could Allow Remote Code Execution (CVE-2012-0175)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a file or directory with a specially crafted name. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the current user.
Note: This detection may have false alerts because some non-Windows operating system may create filenames using special characters which are not allowed on Windows systems.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Data Access Components Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-1975)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Windows Data Access Tracing component handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Briefcase Integer Underflow Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-1527)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows Briefcase is prone to a a remote code-execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the affected application. Failed attempts may trigger a denial-of-service condition.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability (CVE-2020-0601)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'.
Note: This DPI rule looks for possible spoof of following certificates: 1. Microsoft ECC Product Root Certificate Authority 2018 2. Microsoft ECC TS Root Certificate Authority 2018

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMBv3 Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2018-0833)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in implementations of the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause the affected system to stop responding until it is manually restarted.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Credential Reflection Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol handles NTLM credentials when a user connects to an attacker's SMB server. This vulnerability allows an attacker to replay the user's credentials back to them and execute code in the context of the logged-on user. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft SMB Credential Reflection Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol handles NTLM credentials when a user connects to an attacker's SMB server. This vulnerability allows an attacker to replay the user's credentials back to them and execute code in the context of the logged-on user. If a user is logged on with administrative user rights, an attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Server Suspicious SMB Session
PayloadFilter2.Description: This DPI rule detects the usage of suspicious SMB command used to create covert channels in SMB. This kind of attack is used by attack payloads like doublepulsar.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Client Suspicious SMB Session
PayloadFilter2.Description: This DPI rule detects the usage of suspicious SMB command used to create covert channels in SMB. This kind of attack is used by attack payloads like doublepulsar.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Intel Active Management Technology Escalation Of Privilege (CVE-2017-5689)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unprivileged network attacker could gain system privileges to provisioned Intel manageability SKUs: Intel Active Management Technology (AMT) and Intel Standard Manageability (ISM).

PayloadFilter2.Name: Skype Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2017-6517)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Skype is vulnerable to a remote code execution vulnerability. This vulnerability exists due to the way .dll files are loaded by Skype. It allows an unauthenticated attacker to load a malicious .dll file that could execute arbitrary code without the user's knowledge.

PayloadFilter2.Name: DNS Request To ShadowPad Domain Detection
PayloadFilter2.Description: ShadowPad is a backdoor vulnerability discovered in various NetSarang software products. Exploiting this issue allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary system commands with superuser privileges.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Services Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2019-0708)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Remote Desktop Services when an unauthenticated attacker connects to the target system using Remote Desktop Protocol and sends specially crafted requests. This vulnerability is pre-authentication and requires no user interaction. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code on the target system. An attacker could then install programs, view, change, or delete data, or create new accounts with full user rights.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Kingsoft Office Path Subversion Arbitrary DLL Injection Code Execution Vulnerability Over Network Share
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Kingsoft Office while loading the DLL file. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Insecure Binary Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2014-0315)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Windows processes .bat and .cmd files that are run from an external network. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Visio OLE DLL Loading Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2016-3235)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Microsoft Visio improperly validates input before loading dynamic link library (DLL) files. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Office Chinese Grammar Checking Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2014-1756)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in Microsoft Office, when the Simplified Chinese Proofing Tool is enabled, allows remote attacker to gain unauthorized privileges in the context of the current logged-in user.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows LNK Remote Code Execution Over SMB (CVE-2017-8464)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability has been found in the way Windows Explorer handles LNK files. An attacker exploiting this vulnerability could achieve Remote Code Execution.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability (CVE-2020-0601) - 1
PayloadFilter2.Description: A spoofing vulnerability exists in the way Windows CryptoAPI (Crypt32.dll) validates Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) certificates.An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by using a spoofed code-signing certificate to sign a malicious executable, making it appear the file was from a trusted, legitimate source, aka 'Windows CryptoAPI Spoofing Vulnerability'.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DNSAPI Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-11779)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Windows Domain Name System (DNS) when it fails to properly handle DNS responses. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the local system account.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified BADRABBIT Ransomware Propagation Over SMB
PayloadFilter2.Description: This DPI rule blocks lateral movement of BADRABBIT ransomware over SMB.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Memory Corruption Vulnerability (CVE-2014-0549)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to an unspecified memory-corruption vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows OLE Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Over SMB
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability exists in Windows OLE that could allow remote code execution if a user opens a file that contains a specially crafted OLE object over SMB. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Planting Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2015-0096)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability exists in Microsoft Windows that may allow execution of arbitrary code on the target machine. The vulnerability is due to a design weakness in Windows Shell which incorrectly parses shortcuts in such a way that malicious code may be executed when the crafted file is opened either manually or automatically with Windows Explorer.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0176)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code on the target system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows NETLOGON Spoofing Vulnerability (CVE-2015-0005)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability exist in the NETLOGON service that could allow spoofing if an attacker who is logged on to a domain-joined system runs a specially crafted application that could establish a connection with other domain-joined systems as the impersonated user or system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (MS17-010)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) service handles certain requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerabilities could gain code execution on the target server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMBv1 Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) service handles certain requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerabilities could gain code execution on the target server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerabilities Over Network Share (MS15-132)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerabilities exist when Windows fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it in run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Office DLL Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2017-0197)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Office improperly validates input before loading dynamic link library (DLL) files. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerabilities Over Network Share (MS16-014)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
Remote code execution vulnerabilities exist when Windows fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it in run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.
This rule blocks the attacks identified as CVE-2016-0041 and CVE-2016-0042.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Acrobat DLL Loading Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2017-3013)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists when Adobe Acrobat and Reader improperly validates input before loading dynamic link library (DLL) files. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Server Message Block Memory Corruption Vulnerability (CVE-2015-2474)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is prone to an unauthorized access vulnerability that affects the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) protocol software. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application. Failed attacks will cause denial-of-service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: DNS Malformed Response Detected
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule validates DNS responses to detect DNS protocol anomalies.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0148)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) service handles certain requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerabilities could gain code execution on the target server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Response Parsing Vulnerability (CVE-2011-1268)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) client implementation handles specially crafted SMB responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted SMB response to a client-initiated SMB request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code and take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Information Disclosure Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0147)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An information disclosure vulnerability has been reported in the SMB Server component of Microsoft Windows. The vulnerability is due to improper handling of SMBv1 requests. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could exploit the vulnerability by sending a crafted request to a target SMB server. Successful exploitation could result in the disclosure of information which may be used to facilitate further attacks.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0145)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) service handles certain requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerabilities could gain code execution on the target server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: SMB Request Parsing Vulnerability (CVE-2011-1267)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) Protocol software handles specially crafted SMB requests. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted network message to a computer running the Server service.

PayloadFilter2.Name: OLE Automation Underflow Vulnerability ( CVE-2011-0658 )
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Object Linking and Embedding (OLE) Automation. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Windows Client Port Mapper Decoder
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote Procedure Call (RPC) is an interprocess communication (IPC) mechanism that enables data exchange and invocation of functionality residing in a different process. A client will call the endpoint mapper (EPM) at the server to ask for a "well known" service. The server will answer the client at which port this service is available. This rule decodes the port shared by the Server using DCE/RPC Endpoint Mapper (EPM) Protocol, and help other rules for monitoring traffic on the dynamically opened port.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Windows DCERPC AUTH LEVEL CONNECT Password Validate Request
PayloadFilter2.Description: This is a heuristic based rule, which detects if the AUTH LEVEL CONNECT is used as a DCERPC level authentication protection for Password Validate request. AUTH LEVEL CONNECT is not secure, an attacker having MITM situation could tamper the traffic and discover other domain passwords.

PayloadFilter2.Name: DNSMessenger Malware Domain Blocker
PayloadFilter2.Description: This DPI rule block domains used by DNSMessenger malware.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player DLL Hijacking Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2016-1014)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a DLL hijacking vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial of service states.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerabilities Over Network Share (CVE-2016-0160 and CVE-2016-0148)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerabilities exist when Windows fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it in run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Visio Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2010-3148)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft Visio handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Tree Connect Response Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0016)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is prone to a denial of service vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability by causing a Windows system to connect to a malicious SMB share. Successful exploitation attempt may result in denial-of-service condition by crashing Windows.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Expression Design Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-0016)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows Expression Design component while loading the DLL file. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Local Security Authority Subsystem Service Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2016-7237)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Microsoft Windows is prone to a denial of service vulnerability that affects the Microsoft Server Message Block (SMB) protocol software. A remote, authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a maliciously crafted packet to the target system. Successful exploitation could lead to denial-of-service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Color Control Panel Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2010-5082)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Color Control Panel handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Local Security Authority Subsystem Service Integer Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the Microsoft Windows Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) due to its improper handling of malformed packets during NTLM authentication. An attacker could create specially crafted anonymous NTLM authentication requests that would cause a crash in the LSASS service and subsequently would restart the computer.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Internet Explorer Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-2019)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Internet Explorer handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain the same user rights as the logged-on user.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-1854)
PayloadFilter2.Description: The vulnerability could allow remote code execution if a user opens a legitimate Microsoft Office file that is located in the same directory as a specially crafted dynamic link library (DLL) file. An attacker could then install programs, view, change or delete data or create new accounts that have full user rights.

PayloadFilter2.Name: PowerPoint Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-3396)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Microsoft PowerPoint handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Indeo Codec Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2010-3138)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Indeo Codec handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Acrobat DLL Loading Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2016-1008)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Acrobat and Reader are prone to a vulnerability that lets attackers execute arbitrary code. An attacker can exploit this issue by enticing a legitimate user into opening a pdf file from a network share location that contains a specially crafted Dynamic Linked Library (DLL) file.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows CredSSP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2018-0886)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Credential Security Support Provider protocol (CredSSP). An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could relay user credentials and use them to execute code on the target system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Oracle Job Scheduler Named Pipe Command Execution Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: An arbitrary command execution vulnerability exists in Oracle Job Scheduler. The Job Scheduler listens on a named pipe and execute arbitrary commands received over this channel. In order to connect to the named pipe remotely, SMB access is required.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Oracle Java JRE Insecure Executable Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share
PayloadFilter2.Description: Oracle Java JRE is prone to an insecure executable loading vulnerability which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a user's system. The vulnerability is caused due to the application loading an executable file in an insecure manner when an out of memory condition occurs.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Remote Desktop Protocol Vulnerability (CVE-2012-2526)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability exists in Remote Desktop Server implementation, when handling certain packets. This may lead to crash or remote code execution.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Object Packager Insecure Executable Launching Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-0009)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Windows registers and uses the Windows Object Packager. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Briefcase Integer Overflow Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-1528)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Briefcase feature in Windows. An attacker could exploit the vulnerability by convincing a user to open a specially crafted Windows Briefcase. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the security context of the current user.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows RPC Downgrade Vulnerability (CVE-2016-0128) - 1
PayloadFilter2.Description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the Security Account Manager (SAM) and Local Security Authority (Domain Policy) (LSAD) remote protocols when they accept authentication levels that do not protect the RPC channel adequately. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain access to the SAM database.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DLL Loading Vulnerabilities Over Network Share (MS16-007)
PayloadFilter2.Description:
Remote code execution vulnerabilities exist when Windows fails to validate the authenticity of a module before loading it in run-time. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application.
This rule blocks the attacks identified as CVE-2016-0014, CVE-2016-0016 and CVE-2016-0018.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Windows Components Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-1991)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that certain Windows components handle the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows RPC Downgrade Vulnerability (CVE-2016-0128)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in the Security Account Manager (SAM) and Local Security Authority (Domain Policy) (LSAD) remote protocols when they accept authentication levels that do not protect the RPC channel adequately. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could gain access to the SAM database.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Telnet Handler Remote Code Execution Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2011-1961)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way the telnet URI handler is used by the web browser. The handler may be used in such a way that an attacker could execute arbitrary code in the context of the logged-on user. This filter blocks all web pages accessed over network share which have reference to the telnet protocol 'telnet://' or 'rlogin://' or 'tn3270://'.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player DLL Hijacking Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2016-4140)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a DLL hijacking vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial of service states.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2017-0004)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in the way the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) handles authentication requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could cause a denial of service on the target system's LSASS service, which triggers an automatic reboot of the system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: DFS Memory Corruption Vulnerability (CVE-2011-1868)
PayloadFilter2.Description: An unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Distributed File System (DFS) client parses specially crafted DFS responses. An attempt to exploit the vulnerability would not require authentication, allowing an attacker to exploit the vulnerability by sending a specially crafted DFS response to a client-initiated DFS request. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could execute arbitrary code and take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Print Spooler Service Format String Vulnerability (CVE-2012-1851) II
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Windows Print Spooler service that could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows DNSAPI Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2018-8225)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in Windows Domain Name System (DNS) when it fails to properly handle DNS responses. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run arbitrary code in the context of the local system account.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Print Spooler Service Format String Vulnerability (CVE-2012-1851)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Windows Print Spooler service that could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on an affected system. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Security Bypass Vulnerability Over Network Share (CVE-2012-0756)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to an unspecified remote security-bypass vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Active Accessibility Insecure Library Loading Vulnerability (CVE-2011-1247)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Microsoft Active Accessibility component handles the loading of DLL files. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows SMB Remote Code Execution Vulnerabilities (CVE-2017-0144 and CVE-2017-0146)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Remote code execution vulnerabilities exists in the way that the Microsoft Server Message Block 1.0 (SMBv1) service handles certain requests. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerabilities could gain code execution on the target server.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2015-2373)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code on the target system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Remote Arbitrary Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2013-2555)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to a remote arbitrary code execution vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the application or cause denial of service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Memory Corruption Vulnerability (CVE-2014-0551)
PayloadFilter2.Description: Adobe Flash Player is prone to an unspecified memory-corruption vulnerability. An attacker can exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code in the context of the user running the affected application. Failed exploit attempts will likely result in denial-of-service conditions.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Remote Desktop Protocol Vulnerability (CVE-2012-0002)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that the Remote Desktop Protocol accesses an object in memory that has been improperly initialized or has been deleted. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code on the target system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Microsoft Internet Explorer Information Disclosure Vulnerability Over SMB (CVE-2016-3321)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A file name information disclosure vulnerability was discovered within Internet Explorer. The issue lies in the fact that Internet Explorer's behavior changes when dealing with URIs that point to existing local files versus URIs that point to non-existent files. It allows malicious pages to enumerate the existence of files in the victim's file system. This vulnerability was triggered only by local pages or ones opened from a network share.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Remote Administration Protocol Stack Overflow Vulnerability
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the way that Windows networking components handle specially crafted RAP responses. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could run arbitrary code on the target system. An attacker could then install programs; view, change, or delete data; or create new accounts with full user rights.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Foxit Reader Arbitrary DLL Injection Code Execution Vulnerability Over Network Share
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Foxit Reader while loading the DLL file. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could take complete control of an affected system.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Adobe Flash Player Object Confusion Vulnerability (CVE-2012-0779)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A vulnerability has been reported in Adobe Flash Player, which can be exploited by malicious people to compromise a user's system. The vulnerability is caused due to an error related to object confusion.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Remote Administration Protocol Denial Of Service Vulnerability (CVE-2012-1850)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in Windows networking components. The vulnerability is due to the service not properly handling specially crafted RAP requests.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Windows Netlogon Service Denial Of Service (CVE-2010-2742)
PayloadFilter2.Description: A remote authenticated denial of service vulnerability exists in implementations of the Netlogon RPC Service on affected versions of Windows Server. An attacker who successfully exploited this vulnerability could cause affected versions of the Windows Server to restart.

PayloadFilter2.Name: Identified Reverse Shell Communication Over HTTPS - 2 (ATT&CK T1071.001)
PayloadFilter2.Description: This rule heuristically detects the initial communication between the compromised machine and C&C server.

ConnectionType.Name: Intel AMT
ConnectionType.Description: Intel Active Management Technology (Intel AMT) is a feature of Intel Core processors with Intel vPro technology1,2 and workstation platforms based on select Intel Xeon processors. Intel AMT uses integrated platform capabilities and popular third-party management and security applications, to allow IT or managed service providers to better discover, repair, and protect their networked computing assets

ConnectionType.Name: DCERPC Services
ConnectionType.Description: Remote procedure call (RPC) is a protocol that is used by the Windows and Linux (Samba) operating system. RPC provides an inter-process communication mechanism that allows a program that is running on one computer to seamlessly access services on another computer. The protocol itself is derived from the Open Software Foundation (OSF) RPC protocol.
